author: Regan Downer
message:
Merge pull request #1752 from tajaber/patch-4

Update PowerShell command for tenant flags

ai_summary.Messages:
{"role":"user","content":"The following is the commit files that have changed: {
  "sha": "87ceccbf2c458b5df5d5ce3a7716b04118d795a8",
  "filename": "docs/identity/hybrid/cloud-sync/how-to-inbound-synch-ms-graph.md",
  "status": "modified",
  "additions": 1,
  "deletions": 1,
  "changes": 2,
  "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/2b0ca3587b757b512452695eb336c3a7f2f9fca2/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fcloud-sync%2Fhow-to-inbound-synch-ms-graph.md",
  "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/2b0ca3587b757b512452695eb336c3a7f2f9fca2/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fcloud-sync%2Fhow-to-inbound-synch-ms-graph.md",
  "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fcloud-sync%2Fhow-to-inbound-synch-ms-graph.md?ref=2b0ca3587b757b512452695eb336c3a7f2f9fca2",
  "patch": "@@ -40,7 +40,7 @@ Use these [Microsoft Graph PowerShell](/powershell/microsoftgraph/) commands to\n ### Enable tenant flags\n \n ```powershell\n-Connect-MgGraph -Scopes \"DeviceManagementConfiguration.ReadWrite.All\" ('-Environment <AzureEnvironment>')\n+Connect-MgGraph -Scopes \"Organization.ReadWrite.All\" ('-Environment <AzureEnvironment>')\n $organizationId = (Get-MgOrganization).Id\n $params = @{\n \tonPremisesSyncEnabled = $true"
}. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response: This commit modifies the `how-to-inbound-synch-ms-graph.md` documentation file. The change updates the scope used for connecting to Microsoft Graph PowerShell from `DeviceManagementConfiguration.ReadWrite.All` to `Organization.ReadWrite.All`. This adjustment is likely to ensure the correct permissions are granted for the intended operation within the documentation's described process.

author: Regan Downer
message:
Merge pull request #1751 from TeeEarls/patch-12

Renewed mention of LCW being "new" and rephased opening

ai_summary.Messages:
{"role":"user","content":"The following is the commit files that have changed: {
  "sha": "aab3a5be9f9cb4c20a4b57c34ec1fb78b617449b",
  "filename": "docs/id-governance/what-are-lifecycle-workflows.md",
  "status": "modified",
  "additions": 1,
  "deletions": 1,
  "changes": 2,
  "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/15747181d16b842c0dfdd871d7bc0ac2b2d92ef6/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fwhat-are-lifecycle-workflows.md",
  "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/15747181d16b842c0dfdd871d7bc0ac2b2d92ef6/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fwhat-are-lifecycle-workflows.md",
  "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fwhat-are-lifecycle-workflows.md?ref=15747181d16b842c0dfdd871d7bc0ac2b2d92ef6",
  "patch": "@@ -12,7 +12,7 @@ ms.author: owinfrey\n \n # What are lifecycle workflows?\n \n-Lifecycle workflows are a new identity governance feature that enables organizations to manage Microsoft Entra users by automating these three basic lifecycle processes:\n+Lifecycle workflows (LCW) are identity governance capabilities that enable organizations to manage Microsoft Entra users across the three phases of a user's lifecycle with an organization:\n \n - **Joiner**: When an individual enters the scope of needing access. An example is a new employee joining a company or organization.\n - **Mover**: When an individual moves between boundaries within an organization. This movement might require more access or authorization. An example is a user who was in marketing and is now a member of the sales organization."
}. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response: This commit refactors a sentence in the documentation for Lifecycle Workflows. The updated text clarifies that these workflows manage Microsoft Entra users across the three distinct phases of their lifecycle with an organisation, rather than just automating three basic processes. The acronym LCW is also introduced for brevity.
